file_content.text: --a love the hand of Tyth could not deny....
We're headed back into the heart of Arcann's empire, and you're singing.
What better time?
Anyway, where we're going, no one will be looking for criminals. Most of the people there are criminals. Which, of course, presents its own dangers.
Even so, I do enjoy visiting the Old World. It's a piece of Zakuul history. Valkorion's first attempt at creating a grand society.
A failed attempt.
Only in scale. To him, it wasn't nearly grand enough.
Hello, little one.
You = welcome // T7 = ready to assist with mission!
Gotten yourself into any trouble while I was gone?
How are you, pal?
Trouble = everywhere // T7 = good at blending in
Teeseven, what do you have for us?
Find out anything new?
New data = unavailable // T7 = searching extensively
I don't suppose you have any news about Doc or Kira or anyone?
Any word from our friends?
Ally status updates = nonexistent // All searches = inconclusive // T7 = never giving up hope
Seems like you're everywhere.
You really get around.
All = see T7 as harmless // T7 = able to go almost anywhere
I want updates, not chatter.
Get to the status report.
Lady of Sorrows = difficult to locate // Operations base = undetermined
The Lady of Sorrows is wanted for murder and theft of state secrets, among other charges. The Knights have hunted her for years. No one's come close.
Look who you're talking to. I'll get her.
Hunting is what I do.
Yes, I've heard you were quite the mercenary.
We'll find her--as a team.
We'll find her--as a team.
I'm sure the three of us will manage if we work together.
They aren't me. I'll find her.
I'm better than your Knights.
With my help, I don't doubt it.
Who has she murdered?
Murder?
Oh, just anyone who's managed to get in her way.
You may not believe this, but it's rare for someone to escape a Knight's justice.
And when that someone is the Knight's own child?
We'll find out, won't we?
Could I...? Is it possible for me to talk to him? To Valkorion.
I don't think it works that way, exactly....
Lots of things live down here. Few of them friendly. We should be careful.
I want to know more about your relationship with Valkorion.
Tell me about you and Valkorion.
The story really isn't as outlandish as whatever you're imagining.
We met after I earned a place in his elite guard. I never hesitated to speak my mind, which... caught his attention, I suppose.
He was fascinating. Bold. Always completely certain of his next step.
The way you describe him, I can't blame you for taking an interest.
I can understand that.
You also have to understand his place in our culture, our psychology... our entire conception of ourselves. He guided Zakuul's prosperity for generations. Centuries.
If I were describing you, I'd say the same things.
[Flirt] Just like you.
You're flattering me. But, yes, somehow we had a fair bit in common.
Every "next step" he took was for his own gain. How did you not see that?
So he was smug and ruthless.
Like I said earlier... the man I knew was different. He did nothing but improve his people's lives.
What we had wasn't a child's notion of romance, but... we were happy. Then the twins came.
I loved Arcann and Thexen, but no matter what I did... they wanted nothing to do with me. And Valkorion wanted nothing to do with them.
His mind was somewhere else. He barely spoke, barely acknowledged any of us for weeks at a time.
And then Vaylin... Vaylin was troubled from the start.
Was she really dangerous even as a child?
She was that bad?
I know this is hard for you. We don't have to keep talking about it if you'd rather not.
We don't have to discuss this.
You'd have to start young to end up as crazy as she is.
Hardly surprising.
She made furniture move while she was still in the womb. Tore droids apart as a toddler. Once, a guard dropped a ball she tossed. Vaylin crippled him.
I've kept it in for twenty years, and I wouldn't say it helped. We'll see if letting it out works any differently.
The boys were always aggressive, but they understood restraint and boundaries. Not Vaylin. She was a danger to everyone around her, even as a child.
I confronted Valkorion. His daughter needed help. His sons needed him.
His "solution" was to cage Vaylin's mind. Most of her power was locked her away, along with most of who she was. He ignored the rest of us outright.
I couldn't stand by and watch. I gathered the children. I tried to tell them we needed to go. They laughed and called me weak.
Even as children--even with Vaylin's power restrained--the three of them together were still far more powerful than me. I couldn't force them to go. So... I left.
I can't imagine how hard that must have been for you.
I'm so sorry.
Did Valkorion try to stop you from leaving?
What did Valkorion do?
You were the only one who wanted to help those children, and you ran away. Now look at them.
Coward.
Better than being trapped there, helpless.
No. I'm not sure he even noticed.
There was nothing I could do for them. I couldn't stay there and watch, helpless.
I transferred to the Knights' enforcement division and took assignments at the outer fringes of our empire. Valkorion never spoke another word to me.
Since then, I've only ever seen my children in broadcasts. I don't even know if they remember me.
Come on--we should keep moving.
Let's keep moving.
What we had wasn't a child's notion of romance, but... we were happy. Then Arcann and his brother, Thexan, were born.
I loved them so much, but no matter what I did... they wanted nothing to do with me. And Valkorion wanted nothing to do with them.
Since then, I've only seen my children in broadcasts of public events... like Thexan's funeral. Killed in the Core Worlds... I doubt they even remember me.
